Class PickupGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • PickupGame

  • public class PickupGame
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulates game of pickup.
    Create an object, then use the play method to simulate a game.
    PickupGame myGame = new PickupGame();
    myGame.play(someScanner);

    COPYRIGHT © 2014 Gabriel Anderson. All Rights Reserved.

    Since:
    09 November 2014

    • Constructor Detail

      • PickupGame

        public PickupGame()
        Constructs a game with a random number of stones and play mode. Stones can be from 8 to 55. Play mode can be any.

      • PickupGame

        public PickupGame(int initialStones)
        Constructs a game with the given initial stones and random play mode.
        Parameters:
        initialStones - Stones each game starts with.

      • PickupGame

        public PickupGame(int initialStones,
          PickupGame.PlayMode playmode)
        Constructs a game with the given stones and playmode.
        Parameters:
        initialStones - Stones each game starts with.
        playmode - Playmode of each game.

    • Method Detail

      • setPlayMode

        public void setPlayMode(PickupGame.PlayMode playmode)
        Set the mode of the computer plays as.
        Parameters:
        playmode - The mode the computer plays each game with.

      • getPlayMode

        public PickupGame.PlayMode getPlayMode()
        Get the mode the computer plays as.
        Returns:
        The computer's play mode.

      • setStones

        public void setStones(int stones)
        Set the number of stones to play with. Value must be from 8 to 55.
        Parameters:
        stones - Number of stones to play each game with.

      • play

        public void play(java.util.Scanner in)
        Play a game from start to finish. Usually, along with a constructor call, this method is all that is ever needed to run a game of pickup.
        Parameters:
        in - The scanner that recieves user input.

      • lose

        public void lose()
        Decides the loser. Called when the last stone is removed by whoever picked it up.

      • pickupStones

        public boolean pickupStones(int stones)
        Pick up the given number of stones. Insures the stones are between 1 and half the current number of stones, Echos to the console when not in range, and returns false.
        Parameters:
        stones - Number of stones to pick up.
        Returns:
        True when stones are picked up, false when no stones are picked up.

      • printHistory

        public void printHistory()
        Prints out the current history to the command line.

      • getHistory

        public java.lang.String getHistory()
        Gets the current history.
        Returns:
        The current history.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a formatted string representing a PickupGame object. Details the instance variables, history, and win percents.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The formatted string representing a PickupGame object.
